intro: Campanula fragilis var. hirta, commonly known as the hairy bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems covered in fine, hairy hairs. The plant produces bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered with a dense layer of short, stiff hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and meadows.
